page.title: 12A Visit to Moorhill
page.content: { Moorhall,}now known as{Moorhill}was built in the year 1861 and was constructed of brick and the window frames of stone. Before{Moorhill}was built there was just farmland streching from{Ryhope Road}to{Tunstall {Hill}called{Sparks Farm.}Remnants of a Tollgate can still be seen near the gates.{Moorhill}was built for the {Robson family}who were owners of local flourmills, for their family home. { Moorhill}had on the first floor 6 bedrooms 2 bathrooms and 3 toilets. The top floor (the attic rooms) were where the servants slept. There are 5 bedrooms, 2 toilets and 1 bathroom. The main bedroom still has call bells. The butler's pantry is now an office. The wine cellar is now used for stores and boilers for central heating and water.
